reviews.text: After staying in Cyprus twice already we decided to book to go again, but to a different part in Paphos with some friends. We came across Eleni Village and got advised that it was a brilliant hotel. However, some reviews stated it was not so great, I disagree! In 2009 the hotel shut down for a year to be completely refurbished and you really can see this now as everything is looking so clean and fresh. The reception area is welcoming and well air conditioned, which is much needed in 45 degrees heat!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are of a good size and has a nice kitchen area. The rooms are cleaned every day except Sundays and are given clean towels as well as bad changing three times a week. The balcony was very spacious and had a nice table and chairs on it too looking out to the pool. The pool was brilliant, and suitable for all although it was like a bath in the heat! There was also no rush for loungers in the morning like most hotels. We were all inclusive and the food was outstanding. Breakfast was ok and basic, nothing to great. However, the lunch pool bar menu is suitable for everyone with fresh hot food. The evening meals again were great, but not a lot of selection for fussy eaters. However, the chef would happily cook you something if you didn't like it.
reviews.title: Fabulous Holiday!!!

reviews.text: All the staff were great but the best were Katy and Mohammed, the two holiday entertainers. Each day water polo is played, water aerobics, bowls competitions, pool competitions, lilo races, fitness and so much more in the day time. They also put on good shows and played typical British bingo at night, which was a great laugh. All the staff were very friendly and cared about the guests. Overall, an extremely great holiday and will be going back to Eleni Village again!
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travelled with friends to attend a wedding (at the little gorgeous church at the end of the road!) and my parents came along too with my 2 girls (aged 4 and 6).
reviews.title: Don't believe all you read

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The layout was very interesting. Not like a hotel, but little 2 storey blocks of 12 apartments on each block. So like a little village i guess! I found this very good, didnt hear anyone in the room next door at all and being in the upstairs of our little block no scraping of furniture above. The only noise (which was a very welcome one for me!!) was of the air con we left going overnight.
reviews.title: Nice hotel ruined by karaoke at midnight and noisy kids in the pool all day.

reviews.text: I should start by saying that different people have different needs and wishes whilst on holiday and although this hotel wasn't quite our cup of tea, I can imagine it would fit the bill for a lot of travellers. I also think this hotel will attract different groups and different parts of the year and therefore, have a change in atmosphere depending on when you visit.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings.....

reviews.text: Unfortunately due to a family trauma we were not able to go until the 28th Aug and things were winding down.
reviews.title: Brilliant Holiday which caters for all ages

reviews.text: We stayed self catering but did eat at the pool bar a couple of times. A seasoned visitor advised us that it was his 8th visit and things have gone a bit downhill, especially with regards to the food. Our lunches were nothing special but ok. Food & drink is quite expensive but then we found most of Cyprus expensive compared to Corfu last year.
reviews.title: fault2 week stay at the Eleni village cyprus

reviews.text: A taxi from the airpost cost us E40 but only E30 to go back to the airport.
reviews.title: get booked now! Great family holiday!

reviews.text: Our room was in block 16 well away from the noise of the entertainment. I'd've gone insane if we'd been placed closer to the foyer/entertainment area. The room was clean and bright but not luxurious by anymeans. Big kingsized bed with fresh crisp, white sheets and changed regularly. The green towels were very worn and smelled a bit of soap and must! Aircon worked seemingly at one temperature no matter what buttons we pressed. It's E11 a week to hire a safe plus E5 deposit.
reviews.title: Didn't want to leave.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked here because we were staying in Cyprus for the week for a wedding. We knew we would be spending a lot of time out and about at various locations and other villas with friends so wanted to lodgings on a budget, but still with value for money and at no compromise. and that is exactly what you get here.
reviews.title: An honest review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in and staff were great, friendly and always present for the whole week. Rooms are a good size and with free A/C, the furnishings are a little dated but they are very clean. Very quiet each night as well which is always good. In short, I would have liked more, but we certainly would not have expected it for what we paid.
reviews.title: Pleasant enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Did self catering so cannot comment too much on the food, although we paid for a couple of lunches at the pool bar and they were more than fine. Prices were ok as well, not cheap but conservative, I think about 3 Euros for a beer as well. The onsite shop is well stocked for English mags and papers, food and drink and pool toys, all at reasonable prices.
reviews.title: The good and the not so good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools are lovely and the kids there seemed to have a great time in them. We did not travel with kids but the hotel seems good for them, Katy the entertainer was often present and organising water polo comps as well as even enterainment each night, although we did not attend these we could see they were on.
reviews.title: wonderful time

reviews.text: NOTE: If your not travelling with kids and want lots of quiet poolside relaxing then you might want to consider the amount of families here.
reviews.title: Best holiday we have ever had thanks to this great hotel and amazing staff

reviews.text: Had to visit Cyprus at short notice to attend funeral, and booked this hotel very much last minute - room only. The price was very reasonable
reviews.title: Good Value for money

reviews.text: The staff were very helpful and understanding of the situation - with me travelling alone, and made sure that I was looked after. I spent some of my time with family friend to support them and part of the time at the hotel to recuperate.
reviews.title: felt very sad!

reviews.text: The pool was good and not overcrowded at the time i visited - found early morning dip very good way to wake up in the morning before going into breakfast. The food was reasonable
reviews.title: we had a great time,and thought very nice holiday overall

reviews.text: Arrived to find hotel almost empty!
reviews.title: Fab holiday

reviews.text: Just reopened after a years closure. However, unlike stated in First Choice brochure there was no daily activities or evening entertainment provided!!!! Due to start the next week.
reviews.title: Great time at The Eleni

likes.disliked: — Location - Nowhere to go for a stroll
